title.narrative: Defending victims of State crimes in front of Peace Courts

description.narrative: A broad number of lawyers which decided to coordinate their work in front of the Peace Courts created after the signing of the Peace Accord between colombian government and the ex-guerrilla group FARC-EP, has captured a lot of information from ex-State agents (overall belonging to the army), declaring many human rights violations coming from different army troops during the years of the armed conflict. They want now to summarize these informations for the victims in the regions where the violations were done to have the opportunity of declaring in front of the courts is the facts described by the military members are truth or not. Partner as well wants to reach a very high affected region by the armed conflict (Barrancabermeja and the Magdalena Medio región), to get as many testimonies as posible from victims of many diferent violent facts (killings, displacements, massacres, people disappearance, etc) executed by military troops in collaboration with paramilitary groups, for presenting these cases and testimonies in front of the Peace Courts. Special folow up of the information gathered on miulitary extrajudicial killings to civilians, that increased a lot during a concrete period at the begining of the 20s.

As the peiod defined for the Peace Courts to receive the cases to be judged related the armed conflict betwwen the State and the ex FARC rebel group, is to end at the beginig of 2020 (two years since the Peace Courts creation), the group of lawyers want to increase the number of cases to be presented with all the posible evidences, as well as to reach emblematic regions in which State agents took action on violence, crimes and human rights violations. And have a special follow up on high level military commanders who participates and ordered the execution of crimes. Of course, presenting for the first time in Colombia, high military members in front of courts with enoug evidence of their participation in terrible crimes against civilians (not combatants), is going to impact at Colombia society and to lead to a better understanding of the conflcit by a vast majority of citizens which will drive to real deep changes in the way of a real rule of law in the whole country.
